 equalsFalse ($bool, $message= '')

Detailed Description

Class Assert has only static methods that can be used to check conditions and trigger errors if they are not met.

Member Function Documentation

Assert::assert (  $  bool,
$  message = ''
)  [static]
 

Check a boolean value and generate a fatal error if it is false. If no error message is specified, the default is 'Assertion failed.'.

Parameters:
$bool the boolean value to check
the error message to generate if $bool evaluates to false

Assert::equals (  $  value1,
$  value2,
$  message = ''
)  [static]
 

Compare two values and trigger a warning if they are unequal. If no error message is specified, the two values will be printed.

Parameters:
$value1 the first value
$value2 the second value
the error message to generate if $value1 != $value2

Assert::equalsTrue (  $  bool,
$  message = ''
)  [static]
 

Check if a value is true and trigger a warning if this is not the case.

Parameters:
$bool the value to check for true-ness
$message the error message to generate if $bool equals false

Assert::equalsFalse (  $  bool,
$  message = ''
)  [static]
 

Check if a value is false and trigger a warning if this is not the case.

Parameters:
$bool the value to check for false-ness
$message the error message to generate if $bool equals true
